  • Constructor Details

    • UserFacadeService

      public UserFacadeService(EmailClientTool emailClientTool, PrivateUserService privateUserService, PublicUserService publicUserService)
      The constructor
      Parameters:
      emailClientTool - the emailClientService
      privateUserService - the privateUserService
      publicUserService - the publicUserService

  • Method Details

    • registerNewUser

      public PrivateUserEntity registerNewUser(String nickname, String email, String password) throws InvalidUserException, ImageNotFoundException
      Registers a new user by creating both public and private user entities.

      This method first creates a public user with the given nickname, then links it with a private user using the provided email and password.

      Parameters:
      nickname - the desired public nickname of the user
      email - the user's email address used for private identification
      password - the user's password
      Returns:
      the created private user entity
      Throws:
      InvalidUserException - if the user data is invalid or violates business rules
      ImageNotFoundException - if a default profile image could not be found

    • updateNickname

      public void updateNickname(String nickname, int userId) throws UserNotFoundException, NicknameAlreadyTakenException, UnchangedNicknameException, InvalidUserNicknameException
      Updates the nickname of a public user.

      Delegates the update to the public user service. If the new nickname is already taken or is identical to the current one, an exception is thrown.

      Parameters:
      nickname - the new nickname to assign
      userId - the ID of the user whose nickname is to be updated
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if the user does not exist
      NicknameAlreadyTakenException - if the desired nickname is already in use
      UnchangedNicknameException - if the new nickname is the same as the current one
      InvalidUserNicknameException

    • updateProfileImage

      public void updateProfileImage(int profilePictureId, int userId) throws UserNotFoundException, UnchangedImageException, ImageNotFoundException
      Updates the profile image of a public user.

      Attempts to update the user's profile image using the provided image ID. If the new image is the same as the current one, or if the image is not found, exceptions are thrown.

      Parameters:
      profilePictureId - the ID of the new profile image
      userId - the ID of the user whose profile image is to be updated
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if the user does not exist
      UnchangedImageException - if the new image is the same as the current image
      ImageNotFoundException - if the image with the given ID cannot be found

    • updateLanguages

      public void updateLanguages(int userId, String[] languages) throws UserNotFoundException
      Updates the list of favorite languages for the specified public user.

      Delegates the update operation to the PublicUserService. Replaces the user's current language list with the provided one.

      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user whose languages are to be updated
      languages - an array of language representing the user's spoken languages
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if the user does not exist

    • updatePassword

      public void updatePassword(String token, String password, String confirmPassword) throws UserNotFoundException, JwtKnowyException, PasswordFormatException
      Updates a user's password using a password recovery token.

      Validates the token, checks the password format and that both provided passwords match. If all checks pass, the user's password is updated.

      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token used to identify and authorize the password reset
      password - the new password
      confirmPassword - confirmation of the new password
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if no user is associated with the token
      JwtKnowyException - if the token is invalid or expired
      PasswordFormatException - if the password format is invalid or passwords do not match

    • updateEmail

      public void updateEmail(String email, int userId, String password) throws UserNotFoundException, UnchangedEmailException, WrongPasswordException, InvalidUserEmailException
      Updates the email address of a private user after verifying the current password.

      Delegates to PrivateUserService to perform the update. Ensures the new email is different and that the user's password is valid.

      Parameters:
      email - the new email address to set
      userId - the ID of the user whose email is being updated
      password - the user's current password, used for authentication
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if the user does not exist
      UnchangedEmailException - if the new email is the same as the current one
      WrongPasswordException - if the provided password is incorrect
      InvalidUserEmailException

    • isValidToken

      public boolean isValidToken(String token) throws UserNotFoundException
      Verifies whether the given password recovery token is valid.

      Delegates the validation to the PrivateUserService, which checks the integrity, expiration, and user association of the token.

      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token to validate
      Returns:
      true if the token is valid; false otherwise
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if the token refers to a non-existent user

    • sendRecoveryPasswordEmail

      public void sendRecoveryPasswordEmail(String email, String recoveryBaseUrl) throws JwtKnowyException, UserNotFoundException, MailDispatchException
      Sends a password recovery email to the user associated with the given email address.

      Generates a recovery link using the provided base URL and user-specific token, composes an email, and sends it using the configured email client.

      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the user requesting password recovery
      recoveryBaseUrl - the base URL to be used in the recovery link (e.g., frontend reset page)
      Throws:
      JwtKnowyException - if there is a problem generating the recovery token
      UserNotFoundException - if no user is associated with the given email
      MailDispatchException - if the email could not be sent

    • desactivateUserAccount

      public void desactivateUserAccount(String password, String confirmPassword, String email, String recoveryBaseUrl) throws UserNotFoundException, JwtKnowyException, MailDispatchException, WrongPasswordException
      Deactivates the user account after validating the password and confirmation. Sends an email with the account recovery link using the provided recovery base URL.
      Parameters:
      password - the user's current password for validation
      confirmPassword - the confirmation of the password
      email - the email of the user whose account will be deactivated
      recoveryBaseUrl - the base URL to be used for account reactivation link
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if the user with the given email does not exist
      JwtKnowyException - if there is an error generating the JWT token
      MailDispatchException - if sending the recovery email fails
      WrongPasswordException - if the password and confirmation do not match or are incorrect

    • reactivateUserAccount

      public void reactivateUserAccount(String token) throws UserNotFoundException, JwtKnowyException
      Reactivates a previously deactivated user account using a valid reactivation token.
      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token used to verify and reactivate the user account
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if the user associated with the token does not exist
      JwtKnowyException - if the token is invalid or expired
